clean_content:
Definition / general

* Mucinous pancreatic cyst with minimal cytologic atypia, grossly > 1 cm, lined by single layer of gastric type flat epithelium without ovarian type stroma

Essential features

* Unilocular or multilocular mucinous cyst (> 1 cm) with single layer of columnar or cuboidal cells and low grade dysplasia* Paucicellular fibrotic wall with no ovarian type stroma or lymphoid band* Cyst rarely communicates with pancreatic duct* High cyst fluid CEA, low amylase* *KRAS* and *KMT2C* mutations in a subset of cases* Follows benign clinical course, no reported progression to carcinoma

Terminology

* Also called mucinous nonneoplastic cyst, first proposed by Kosmahl et al. in 2002 ([Mod Pathol 2002;15:154](11850544))

ICD coding

* ICD-10: [K86.2](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/K00-K95/K80-K87/K86-/K86.2) - cyst of pancreas

Epidemiology

* 2 - 3.4% of pancreatic resections, 2.2 - 6.7% of pancreatic cyst resections and 7.6 - 10.3% of pancreatic mucinous cyst resections ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161))* Mean age: 64 (range, 20 - 88) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161))* More common in females, F:M = 2.8:1 to 4:1 ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))

Sites

* Body, tail (53 - 69%)* Head, neck, uncinate (31 - 47%) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))

Clinical features

* Asymptomatic or incidental (41 - 49%), abdominal pain (34 - 44%), jaundice (4 - 7%), back pain (11%) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* Size: 1 - 12 cm (mean 2.5 cm) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161))

Diagnosis

* CT or MRI of abdomen* EUS with FNA or biopsy* Cyst fluid analysis* Cytology* Surgical specimen ([StatPearls: Pacreatic Cysts [Accessed 8 June 2020]](30252235))

Laboratory

* Cyst fluid: often elevated CEA, mean 6,797 ng/mL (range, 11 - 64,000 ng/mL) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* Low amylase (unless connected to duct)

Radiology description

* CT / MRI:
  + Unilocular (55 - 59%), multilocular or septated (41 - 45%)+ Rare communication with pancreatic duct (3 - 7%) or mural nodule ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))+ Upstream main pancreatic duct dilatation ([Abdom Radiol (NY) 2017;42:2827](28567485))+ Low signal intensity of cyst fluid on T1 weighted, high on T2 weighted and low on diffusion weighted+ Most with thin cyst wall but can have cyst wall enhancement* EUS:
    + Septate in 26.3%, solid component in 10.5%, possible communication with pancreatic duct in 21% ([Pancreas 2012;41:813](22695095))

Radiology images

Contributed by Amanda Kitson, M.D. and Jiaqi Shi, M.D., Ph.D.  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mucnoncystradio01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mucnoncystradio01.jpg)

CT: abdomen coronal

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mucnoncystradio02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mucnoncystradio02.jpg)

CT abdomen, transverse section

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mucnoncystradio03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mucnoncystradio03.jpg)

T2 MRI: abdomen coronal

Prognostic factors

* Overall benign behavior with no recurrence or malignant transformation ([Am J Surg Pathol 2015;39:1730](26559377), [Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161))

Case reports

* 52 year old man with hematochezia and active bleeding from ampulla ([Korean J Gastroenterol 2017;70:301](29277093))* 71 year old woman with a cystic tumor in the body of the pancreas ([World J Gastroenterol 2005;11:2045](15801005))* 75 year old man with pancreatic cyst ([J Med Case Rep 2019;13:264](31399149))

Treatment

* Often treated with surgical resection due to preoperative imaging indistinguishable from other mucinous neoplasms* Surveillance

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mucnoncystclin02.png)](https://www.researchgate.net/figure/Blood-was-detected-from-the-major-papilla-by-esophagogastroduodenoscopy_fig2_322069587)

Hematochezia and active bleeding from ampulla

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mucnoncystclin03.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6689156/figure/Fig5/)

Pancreatic cyst and elevated posterior wall of gastric body

Gross description

* Unilocular or multilocular cyst, mean size 2.5 cm, range 1.0 - 12 cm ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* No or rare communication with pancreatic duct ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* Usually clear or serous fluid, ~33% with mucinous fluid, rarely serosanguinous or brown-green thick fluid ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* Smooth cyst lining, no or minimal focal papillary excrescences ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* Submit entire lining (or extensive sampling if large cyst) to rule out high grade dysplasia or invasive carcinoma

Gross images

Contributed by Amanda Kitson, M.D. and Jiaqi Shi, M.D., Ph.D.  

[![Multiloculated cyst in pancreatic head](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystgross01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystgross01.jpg)

Multiloculated cyst in pancreatic head

[![Cyst in pancreatic body](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystgross02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystgross02.jpg)

Cyst in pancreatic body

Frozen section description

* > 1 cm unilocular or multilocular cyst* Flat gastric type mucinous epithelium* No significant atypia* No ovarian type stroma

Frozen section images

Contributed by Amanda Kitson, M.D. and Jiaqi Shi, M.D., Ph.D.  

[![Monolayer of mucinous epithelium](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystfroz01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystfroz01.jpg)

Monolayer of mucinous epithelium

[![Epithelium with minimal atypia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystfroz02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystfroz02.jpg)

Epithelium with minimal atypia

[![Fibrotic cyst wall](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystfroz03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystfroz03.jpg)

Fibrotic cyst wall

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Flat monolayer of columnar mucinous epithelium or attenuated cuboidal epithelial cells, often resembling gastric type mucinous epithelium ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* Low grade dysplasia, which may mimic low grade pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PanIN)
    + Focal high grade dysplasia in 8% cases in one study ([Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* No or minimal papillary architecture ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* Paucicellular fibrotic wall with no ovarian type stroma or lymphoid band ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* Degenerative changes in cyst wall common:
          + Hyalinization, myxoid stroma, hemorrhage, calcifications, macrophage clusters, granulation-like tissue ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Amanda Kitson, M.D. and Jiaqi Shi, M.D., Ph.D.  

[![Cuboidal to columnar epithelium](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystmicro01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystmicro01.jpg)

Cuboidal to columnar epithelium

[![Gastric type mucinous epithelium](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystmicro02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystmicro02.jpg)

Gastric type mucinous epithelium

[![Hypocellular stroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystmicro03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystmicro03.jpg)

Hypocellular stroma

[![Focal atypia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystmicro04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmucnoncystmicro04.jpg)

Focal atypia

Cytology description

* Flat honeycomb sheets / nests of cuboidal or columnar cells without significant atypia (100%) ([Pancreas 2013;42:27](22750967), [Pancreas 2012;41:813](22695095))* Round to oval nuclei, small to slightly enlarged, 1 - 2 inconspicuous nucleoli, fine granular chromatin, smooth nuclear contour, nuclear grooves (43.5%), nuclear pseudoinclusions (26.1%) ([Pancreas 2013;42:27](22750967))* Delicate, vacuolated cytoplasm (60.9%), variable in amount ([Pancreas 2013;42:27](22750967))* May show papillary architecture (10.5%), acini formation (10.5%), 3D clusters (5.3%), single cell pattern (5.3%), goblet cells (17.4%) ([Pancreas 2013;42:27](22750967))* Background mucin, macrophages (43.5%), rarely stroma (17.4%) ([Pancreas 2013;42:27](22750967))* Limitations: may not be representative of entire cyst lining* Unremarkable mucin

Positive stains

* [MUC5AC](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmuc2.html#muc5ac) (77 - 90%), [MUC6](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmuc2.html#muc6) (74 - 93%), [MUC1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmucins.html) (35 - 37%), [CK7](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck7.html) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))

Negative stains

* [MUC2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmuc2.html), retained [SMAD4](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsdpc4.html) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* [CDX2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainscdx2.html) (can be focal)* [p53](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsp53.html)

Molecular / cytogenetics description

* *KRAS* mutations in 13 - 55% ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))* *KMT2C* (MLL3) mutations in 62% ([Hum Pathol 2020;101:1](32380013))* *BRAF, RNF43, CDKN2A, SMAD4* mutations in 8% ([Hum Pathol 2020;101:1](32380013))* *TP53* mutations in 15% ([Hum Pathol 2020;101:1](32380013))* Loss of heterozygosity at 10q (*PTEN*) or 17q (ubiquitin E3 ligase ring finger 43 / *RNF43*) reported in 2 cases ([Hum Pathol 2016;55:159](27246174))* Clonality analysis with *HUMARA* gene showed polymorphism ([Hum Pathol 2010;41:513](19954814))

Sample pathology report

* Pancreas, resection:
  + Simple mucinous cyst (see comment)+ Comment: Many of these lesions have *KRAS* mutation. Although there is no consensus, many authors consider this entity a neoplastic process. However, they tend to have a benign behavior with no reported recurrence or malignant transformation after resection.

Differential diagnosis

* [Intraductal pancreatic mucinous neoplasm (IPMN)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasipmn.html):
  + Increased amylase in cyst fluid ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))+ More commonly head of pancreas+ More papillary architecture+ Communicates with pancreatic duct+ Can have high grade dysplasia or be associated with invasive carcinoma* [Mucinous cystic neoplasm (MCN)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmcn.html):
    + Almost exclusively in women+ Body and tail of pancreas+ Can have papillary epithelium+ Can have high grade dysplasia+ Ovarian type stroma ([progesterone receptor / PR](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsprog.html) positive) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2017;141:1330](28968161), [Am J Surg Pathol 2017;41:121](27740966))+ Can be associated with invasive carcinoma* **Retention cyst**:
      + Cystic dilation of pancreatic duct+ Intraluminal obstruction ([Clin Endosc 2015;48:31](25674524))* [Lymphoepithelial cyst](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaslymphoepithelial.html):
        + Squamous or columnar epithelium+ Lymphocytes and germinal centers within the wall* [Epidermoid cyst](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreastrue.html#epidermoidcysts68143):
          + Keratinizing squamous epithelium* **Squamoid cyst**:

- Metaplastic squamous / transitional epithelium ([Clin Endosc 2015;48:31](25674524))
